page.title: 08Old Buildings in Ribchester
page.content: Much of the present parish church was built in the Thirteenth century and later. It has been altered a great deal since then. The nave and chancel are Early English. There are lancet Windows in the east gable of the chancel & the severel smaller ones in other parts of the church especially in the South wall of the chancel.The old carved doorway has a later porch built on to it . The porch used to be two storys high, the upper floor containing a library. The pillars supporting the White Bull came from a Roman Temple and were found in the River Ribble . There is a mounting block outside the front door.And an old stable at the side. Dutton Hall, built in the reign of Charles II by the Townley family contains a judges box and court room. Near by is a barn with an unusual dove-cote.
